snippet: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s effort to subordinate his own voice to the broader enterprise has been a struggle, especially for a man who delights in speaking bluntly.
abstract: Vice President Joseph R Biden Jr, whose blunt style is often a flashpoint for criticism, has worked to restrain his ego in the service of his support role, and Pres Obama has come to appreciate Biden's loyalty, tested over a whip-lashing term; still, some officials close to Obama worry that Biden may become less restrained in sharing his personal positions in the service of his own political ambitions; Biden has not ruled out making a run for president in 2016.
lead_paragraph: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s effort to subordinate his own voice to the broader enterprise has been a struggle, especially for a man who delights in speaking bluntly.

headline.main: For a Blunt Biden, an Uneasy Supporting Role
headline.print_headline: For a Blunt Biden, an Uneasy Supporting Role

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
